intro: Pratia acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pratia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pinkish flowers. It is typically found in sandy soils and is often used in coastal landscapes due to its salt tolerance. Pratia acuminata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
